intro: Dyschoriste diffusa var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically smooth to the touch. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers, which are often borne in terminal or axillary inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the family Rubiaceae.
